channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Cuts to HIV research funding in the US impacts progress towards ending the epidemic
item.description: How will the Trump administration's cuts to HIV research impact the progress that's been made towards ending the epidemic in the U.S.?

item.title: We need each other, say artisans at Smithsonian Folklife Festival
item.description: NPR's Pien Huang takes a journey to the Smithsonian Folklife Festival to hear from youth voices about how they're telling the story of America on the 4th of July.

item.title: Madison McFerrin describes the power of finding her own voice and sound
item.description: Madison McFerrin, daughter of renowned musician Bobby McFerrin, describes her new album Scorpio and the power of finding her own voice and sound.

item.title: Heat and wildfire smoke affect birth outcomes, according to a new study
item.description: Heat and wildfire smoke affect birth outcomes, according to a new study of women in Los Angeles.

item.title: Did humans contribute to evolutionary change in rodents?
item.description: Scientists in Chicago are mapping some fascinating evolutionary changes to local rodents â€” and how humans may have contributed to that change.

item.title: Ukraine attacks Russian airfields
item.description: The Ukrainian military says that today it attacked airfields in Russia, where fighter jets used to bomb Ukrainian cities are stored. They say it's an attempt to weaken the Kremlin's war machine.

item.title: The deadly risk of trying to reach food in Gaza
item.description: An NPR journalist in Gaza describes his experience seeking food from a site run by private American contractors, facing Israeli military fire, crowds fighting for rations, and masked thieves.

item.title: First time novelist writes about life in semi-dystopian reality TV show
item.description: First time novelist, Aisling Rawle, has just published "The Compound" - a book set in a semi-dystopian reality TV show.

item.title: "Catastrophic" flooding brings devastation along Guadalupe River areas
item.description: The number of people dead rose Saturday after the "catastrophic" flooding from Friday Morning along the Guadalupe River in central Texas. Houston Public Radio's Dominic Anthony Walsh reports from the area.

item.title: Texas flooding leaves more than a dozen people dead, 20 missing
item.description: At least 13 people are dead after a "catastrophic" storm and flooding in Texas.
